con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_8" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_8" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:sch7="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_1" xmlns:sch6="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_8" xmlns:sch5="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_6" xmlns:sch4="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v1_6" xmlns:sch3="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6" xmlns:sch2="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5" xmlns:sch1="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:sch0="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_8"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:ws:paymentinitiation:v1_8" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5" xmlns:pay="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v1_8" xmlns:nor="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_1" xmlns:ct="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Services for Creating, Updating and Reading payments.
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 0=OK [validation warnings can appear in errorItems] 10=Bad or missing input 12=No data found 13=Duplicate entry 26=Unknown bank 59=Insufficient funds 70=Technical error 373=Logical duplicate 383=Payment failed due to technical error 464=Receiving account is not valid for real-time payments 466=Invalid security (MAC,crypto,sign) 467=Unexpected transaction change 6000=Validation error [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items, shown below] 6438=Unknown transaction id (Update/Read) 6439=Not a unique payment. Duplicate keys found. 6484=No agreement can be found for this user. 6485=Not authorized for accounts 6489=Not authorized for transaction id 6602=Payment status is not valid for update 6603=Not authorized for operation 6700=Validation error where all transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6701=Validation error where some transactions in payment list failed, [When this ErrorCode is received, you need to check responseState.errorItem for the specific error items per transaction, shown below] 6614=Customer information not found
Validation errors (can be found in responseState.errorItem): 59=Insufficient funds 69=User not authorized for service 419=Invalid due date 465=The requested amount exceeds the allowable limit for real-time payments 6401=Invalid creditor agent identification (Creditor agent) 6402=Invalid creditor account number (Creditor account) 6403=Invalid creditor account number length (Creditor account) 6405=Creditor agent country not open for trade (Creditor agent) 6406=Invalid creditor country code (Creditor) 6407=Blocking found for payment (Warnings and blockings rules) 6408=Counter values can not be calculated due to missing foreign exchange rates for transfer currency (Foreign exchange rate) 6409=Creditor country is missing (Creditor) 6411=Requested execution date passes max forwarding days (Execution date) 6412=Invalid regulatory reporting code (Regulatory reporting) 6413=Regulatory reporting info required (Regulatory reporting) 6414=Transaction amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6415=Periodic amount limit exceeded (Amount limit) 6416=Regulatory reporting amount limit reached and no regulatory reporting codes provided (Regulatory reporting) 6429=Creditor name missing (Creditor)
6440=Creditor agent country code missing (Creditor agent) 6441=Invalid debtor agent identification (Debtor) 6445=Invalid format of OCR (Creditor reference) 6446=OCR number is mandatory for the given creditor account.(Creditor account) 6447=Debtor account must be tax account (Debtor account) 6450=User has no access to payment (Domestic payment) 6452=Creditor town name missing (Cheque payment) 6453=Creditor post code missing (Cheque payment) 6454=Creditor account missing (Cheque payment) 6455=No OCR is provided (Norwegian OCR payment) 6458=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6459=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6460=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6462=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6463=Invalid account number for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6464=Invalid account number length for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6466=Invalid identification for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6467=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 1 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6468=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 2 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6469=Mismatch between country for intermediary agent 3 and BIC (Intermediary agents) 6473=Creditor agent identification missing (Creditor agent) 6475=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 1 country (Currency) 6476=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 2 country (Currency) 6477=Transfer currency invalid in intermediary agent 3 country (Currency) 6481=Identification for intermediary agent 1 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6482=Identification for intermediary agent 2 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6483=Identification for intermediary agent 3 is missing (Intermediary agents) 6486=Invalid country for intermediary agent 1 (Intermediary agents) 6487=Invalid country for intermediary agent 2 (Intermediary agents) 6488=Invalid country for intermediary agent 3 (Intermediary agents) 6490=Transfer currency is not valid. (Currency) 6491=Invalid creditor agent country (Creditor agent) 6494=Tax account is not supported for country (Debtor account) 6497=Register amount limit exceeded (Regulatory reporting) 6498=No OCR agreement found 6503=User not authorized for account 6504=Account is invalid, or user is not authorized to use it 6507=Customer Agreement not found 6512=Bank details not found for IBAN 6513=Creditor agent BIC is required 6515=Creditor agent national id is required 6516=Creditor agent national id is mandatory when creditor account is BBAN 6521=Invalid mid-rate 6522=Invalid sell rate 6523=Invalid agreed rate 6525=Market Product could not be determined 6526=Transaction Fee could not be determined 6534=Transfer currency decimal count exceeded 6532=Unable to determine Payment Type 6533=Unable to determine ISPC 6535=Found no match for the supplied BIC 6536=Found no match for the supplied OrgId 6537=The given cheque type code is invalid 6538=The given delivery method code is invalid 6540=Payment amount is equal or below zero 6541=Creditor account should not be present 6542=The given payment method is not a valid payment method 6543=Invalid category purpose 6544=Category purpose code salary cannot be mixed with other codes 6545=CID or message to receiver is present at the same time as structured information 6546=Creditor agent is missing 6547=Cheque instruction not found 6551=Unknown error from Topup Server (prepaid) 6561=Only unstructured remittance information is allowed for cheque payments 6562=Not able to retrieve service information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6563=Not able to retrieve customer information from recharge system (Prepaid card) 6564=Payment was rejected in recharge system (Prepaid card) 6565=Transaction ok within invalid message (Payment list) 6566=Creditor identification is required (Prepaid card) 6567=Missing Exchange rate 6568=Creditor and Debtor account should not be the same 6569=Service id is required ListCreate (Prepaid card) 6610=Can´t have more than one ISPC for a payment instruction (IPC) 6611=Can not determine ISPC (IPC) 6808=The creditor account must be a valid Norwegian account to qualify for real-time payments 6823=Interim Account not found
Validations warnings (can be found in responseState.errorItem)[payment is stored, user can either ignore warning or do an Update operation to act on those warnings.]: 6404=Requested execution date has passed. Release date has been moved to the next valid bank date. 6410=Cutoff time has passed. Payment might not be released in time for requested execution date (Execution date) 6427=Warning found for payment (Warning and blocking rules) 6456=A similar payment was recently added. Make sure it is not a mistake. (Logical duplicate check) 6470=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in debtor agent country (Execution date) 6471=Release date has been recalculated due to bank holiday in initiator agent country (Execution date) 6472=Payment may not be released in time for requested execution date and will be released on the next valid bank day (Execution date) 6424=Transaction is close to SEPA, but transfer currency is not EUR (SEPA) 6425=Transaction is close to SEPA, but instruction priority is not NORM (SEPA) 6492=Transaction is close to SEPA, but charge bearer is not SHAR (SEPA) 6493=Transaction is close to SEPA, but creditor account number is not an IBAN (SEPA)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v1_1"/> <xs:element name="PaymentCreateRequest" type="tns:PaymentCreateRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Create payment request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentCreateResponse" type="tns:PaymentCreateResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Create payment response</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentUpdateRequest" type="tns:PaymentUpdateRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Update payment request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentUpdateResponse" type="tns:PaymentUpdateResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Update payment response</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentReadRequest" type="tns:PaymentReadRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Read payment request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentReadResponse" type="tns:PaymentReadResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Read payment response</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentHistoricReadRequest" type="tns:PaymentHistoricReadRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Historic read payment request</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentHistoricReadResponse" type="tns:PaymentHistoricReadResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Historic read payment response</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentListCreateRequest" type="tns:PaymentListCreateRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Create a payment list. Supports: list of salaries and list of standard payments.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="PaymentListCreateResponse" type="tns:PaymentListCreateResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Response from PaymentListCreate</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:complexType name="PaymentCreateRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentMessage" type="pay:PaymentCreateMessage"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentCreateResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentUpdateRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentMessage" type="pay:PaymentUpdateMessage"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentUpdateResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentReadRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique database id for the transaction part of the payment instruction. This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment. This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentReadResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentReadResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentHistoricReadRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The unique database id for the transaction part of the payment instruction. This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="paymentReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment. This has been given in create/update/transactionSearch response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentHistoricReadResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentHistoricReadResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentListCreateRequestType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentListCreateMessage" type="pay:PaymentListCreateMessage"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentListCreateResponseType"> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:baseResponseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentResult" type="pay:PaymentListResult"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Used to separate different service consumers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DestinationApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the destination of the message. Used to separate different service providers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Function" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the service to be called.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Version" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Service version "X.Y.Z" according to this standard: X = Main release (major changes, not necessarily backwards compatible) Y = Minor release (backwards compatible, new functionality) Z = Bugfix (backwards compatible, error correction only)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ClientContext" type="ClientContextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Elements for identifying client context information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="AutHeader" type="EDBHeaderType"/> <xsd:complexType name="ResponseStateType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="ErrorCode" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric error code reported for this error.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Severity" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response Status Severity Code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ComponentId" type="xsd:int"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique code identifying the component returning the service response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="StrErrorCode" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Error code represented as String</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Message" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Message describing the error. Default is english language. Optionally localized according to the locale parameter in the service request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="NativeError" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Deprecated: Optional detailed error information reported from involved components. Used for diagnostics purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="LogSequence" nillable="true" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional key generated to be used for log correlation purposes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="errorItem" nillable="true" type="errorItemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional extention items - key/value pairs are used for extented error inforamtion.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="errorItemType"> <xsd:annotation/> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5"> <xs:simpleType name="ISODate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:date"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ISODateTime"> <xs:restriction base="xs:dateTime"/> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max15NumericText"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[0-9]{1,15}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="DecimalNumber"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="17"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BaseOneRate"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="10"/> <xs:totalDigits value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="5"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Balance_SimpleType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="5"/> <xs:totalDigits value="18"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Amount_SimpleType_NoFractions"> <xs:restriction base="xs:decimal"> <xs:fractionDigits value="0"/> <xs:totalDigits value="12"/> <xs:minInclusive value="0"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is normal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{6,6}[A-Z2-9][A-NP-Z0-9]([A-Z0-9]{3,3}){0,1}"/> <xs:minLength value="8"/> <xs:maxLength value="11"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{3,3}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="CountryCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[A-Z]{2,2}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CLIENT_GENERATED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ISO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an ISO file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a NDR file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELEPAY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Telepay file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMUL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Paymul file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALARY_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a salary file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMENT_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a payment list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PREPAID_LIST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a prepaid list file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="STANDING_ORDER_FILE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a standing order file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="STANDING_ORDER_ONLINE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an online standing order</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="UNKNOWN"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unknown origin (migrated?)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_HIGH_PRIORITY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_HIGH_PRIORITY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>DOMESTIC_CURRENCY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_TRANSFER_URGENT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_TRANSFER_URGENT</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DOMESTIC_CURRENCY_TRANSFER"> <xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS0H"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Signer is not allowed to sign for this account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS0K"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The number of transaction is over the number allowed for this signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS10"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is revoked for the first signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS11"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is not valid (revoked or not active) for the first signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS12"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is not present for the first signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS13"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The authority of signer certification sending the certificate is unknown for the first signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS14"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The user is unknown on the server</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS15"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The same signature has already been sent to the bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS16"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The public key version is not correct. This code is returned when a customer sends signature files to the financial institution after conversion from an older program version (old ES format) to a new program version (new ES format) without having carried out re-initialisation with regard to a public key change.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS17"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Order data and signatures don't match</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS18"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>File cannot be tested, the complete order has to be repeated. This code is returned in the event of a malfunction during the signature check, e.g. not enough storage space.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS19"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The user's rights (concerning his signature) are insufficient to execute the order</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS20"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is revoked for the second signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS21"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is not valid (revoked or not active) for the second signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS22"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The certificate is not present for the second signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS23"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The authority of signer certification sending the certificate is unknown for the second signer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS24"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Waiting time expired due to incomplete order</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS25"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The order file was deleted by the bank server (for multiple reasons)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS26"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The same user has signed multiple times</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DS27"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The user is not yet activated (technically)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid date (eg, wrong or missing settlement date)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT02"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid creation date and time in Group Header (eg, historic date)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT03"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invalid non bank processing date (eg, weekend or local public holiday)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT04"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Future date not supported</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT05"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Associated message, payment information block or transaction was received after agreed processing cut-off date, i.e., date in the past.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DT06"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Execution Date has been modified in order for transaction to be processed</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DU01"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Message Identification is not unique.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="SPOT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SALE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the market rate at the time of the sale.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Psd2ConfigurationType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="AISP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>AISP - Account parties.) or PISP(PSD2 transactions) on this account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema namespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v21"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="st:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="st:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="st:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="st:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="st:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="st:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="st:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="st:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="st:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="st:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="st:Max18Long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="st:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> Can be given as an alternative to requestedExecutionDate. This is the date on which the creditor's account is to be credited.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtorAgentBIC" type="st:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BIC of debtor agent. Only needs to be provided if debtor agent is other than initiator agent, e.g. for foreign account purposes. If left out, PI will set debtorAgent=initiatorAgent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateDebtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Ultimate party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionForDebtorAgent" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, that may need to be acted upon by the debtor agent, depending on agreement between debtor and the debtor agent. Usage: when present, then the instructions for the debtor agent apply for all credit transfer transaction information occurrences, present in the payment information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentMethodCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHK"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Written order to a bank to pay a certain amount of money from one person to another person.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TRF"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transfer of an amount of money in the books of the account servicer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentTypeInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionPriority" type="st:PriorityCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Urgency or order of importance that the originator would like the recipient of the payment instruction to apply to the processing of the payment instruction."
Values: HIGH, NORM
Default: NORM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceLevel" type="st:ServiceLevelCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed"
Values: URGP, NRTP, INTD, EINV, NRTR, DRDB, GLMS
Default: (none)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="localInstrument" type="st:LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "User community specific instrument. Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level."
Values: TO BE DECIDED! (not an enum yet..)
Default:</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="categoryPurpose" type="st:CategoryPurposeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories. Usage: This is used by the initiating party to provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain."
For banks using DNB Payment engine for international payments: PI will set this value based on instructionPriority.
Values: INVS, SALA, IDCP, CASH, CORT, INTC, PENS, SSBE, SUPP, TAXS, TREA, VATX, LOAN, OTHR
Default: SUPP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_6" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5" xmlns:ct="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6" xmlns="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v1_6"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-complex-types:v6"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pays.payment.evry.com:domain:sepa-simple-types:v5"/> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeRateInformation" type="ct:ExchangeRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeBearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction." Values: SHAR, DEBT, CRED, SLEV Default set by PAYS if missing in request: SHAR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent1" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #1 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent2" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #2 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="intermediaryAgent3" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agent #3 between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAgent" type="ct:FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateCreditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Ultimate party to which an amount of money is due.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="instructionForCreditorAgent" type="ct:InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="regulatoryReporting" type="ct:RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="internalNote" type="st:Max40Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal note, not part of the ISO standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeInstruction" type="ct:ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Purp - Underlying reason for the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="purposeCode" type="st:Max4Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See ISO "Payment Purpose Code" external code set for valid values</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="purposeProprietary" type="st:Max35Text"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SimpleCreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message." Here: a simplified transaction compared to CreditTransferTransactiond-element.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction" Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.
Client must provide each transaction an id in order to link possible error codes in the response with the erroneous transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="customerId" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies customer connected to the prepaid card in the recharge system. Mandatory when PaymentList Type is IDCP Recharge Pre pay cards</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."
Since paymentList only support domestic payments, it would only make sense to use instructed amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditorName" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due." Here: simplified to only use name.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="st:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."
Here: limit to only 1 x 140 characters</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="st:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Will be mapped against PBD.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="transactionFee" type="ct:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An indication of fees connected to sending this payment.
