<xs:simpleType name="Max200Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="200"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max105Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="105"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="Max254Text"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="1"/> <xs:maxLength value="254"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="trueFalseAndAnyStatus"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TRUE"/> <xs:enumeration value="FALSE"/> <xs:enumeration value="ANY"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:minLength value="2"/> <xs:maxLength value="8"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="SortingDirection"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ASCENDING"/> <xs:enumeration value="DESCENDING"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MarketType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="MarketTypeCriteria"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ALL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ALL</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="subDepartment" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="cm:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Typical use: invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:ReferredDocumentType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of referred document." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous identification of the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="relatedDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date associated with the referred document."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="invoiceeOtherId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the party to whom an invoice is issued, when it is different from the debtor or ultimate debtor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="tns:ReferredDocumentInformation"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentAmount" type="tns:ReferredDocumentAmount"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditNoteAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: DISP, FXDR, PUOR, RADM, RPIN, SCOR</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Entity that assigns the credit reference type</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="reference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeType" type="st:ChequeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of cheque to be issued." Values: BCHQ</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="deliveryMethod" type="st:DeliveryMethodType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the delivery method of the cheque by the debtor's agent." If no results found error code 12 is returned=Not found
Error Conditions (responseState.ErrorCode): 70=Technical error (Uncategorized) 69=User not authorized for service (Authorization) 6503=User not authorized for account 6553=Search over migration date prohibited 6801=Debtor accounts is mandatory in search against CPS 6802=From, to or exact date is mandatory in search against CPS 6803=PaymentInfoId is mandatory in transaction level search against CPS 6560=Either InitiatorIdentifier or DebtorAccount must be set (this error code can only occur for employees)
Validation errors (can be found in responseState.errorItem): 6615=Rejected or cancelled payments cannot be queried at a booking level (never booked) 6616=Historic search can only find payments with COMPLETED status, for other statuses use non-historic search 6617=Search criteria has been updated</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:import xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DEBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CRED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All transaction charges are to be borne by the creditor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SHAR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In a credit transfer context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the debtor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the creditor. In a direct debit context, means that transaction charges on the sender side are to be borne by the creditor, transaction charges on the receiver side are to be borne by the debtor.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SLEV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges are to be applied following the rules agreed in the service level and/or scheme.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ChargeInfoTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="TOTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TOTA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Total amount in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DNBT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Product charge specified in the transfer currency deducted from the transfer amount. Pertains only to outgoing payments where charges on the sender side are to be borne by the beneficiary.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="OURA"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Charges on the beneficiary side to be borne by the sender in account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO1"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 1 = Debited account separately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 2 = Accumulated and debited/invoiced at intervals.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRO3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>From ProFX: 3 = Fees deducted from transferred amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="PriorityCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="HIGH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is high.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NORM"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Priority level is normal.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="OriginalFormatCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CLIENT_GENERATED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a client.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ISO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from an ISO file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a NDR file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELEPAY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Telepay file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PAYMUL"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generated from a Paymul file</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EinvoiceType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UUIDv4Type"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[a-f0-9]{8}-[a-f0-9]{4}-4[a-f0-9]{3}-[ab89]{1}[a-f0-9]{3}-[a-f0-9]{12}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceLevelCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="URGP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urgent payment - ISO code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Norwegian real-time payment - EVRY proprietary code. The transaction will be reserved on both the debitor and creditor and completed immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EINV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice - EVRY proprietary code. This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. If an eInvoice is created with in payment initiation without this service level, it is the responsibility of the calling system to update NETS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INTD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal direct debit - EVRY proprietary code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No real time reservation - EVRY proprietary code. This can be used if the due date is equal to today's date to skip over an immediate reservation, that is, to create reservations when the ReservationEngine normally runs</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DRDB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Direct debit - EVRY proprietary code (for example, AvtaleGiro)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GLMS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use from GLM. It will force the payment being processed as "real foreign account", and sent as MT101 (or whatever PBD's foreign agreement says)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOCR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use in domestic and foreign domestic, normal priority payments without an advice out.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ZRCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will activate skipping charges during payment processing. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DVCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will mark the payment as having a deviating charge. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AutoConfirm"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DISABLED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Default if not given. Clients will require calling payment status update confirm web service to activate the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_BUT_DISABLED_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If any warnings are encountered during validation, then autoConfirm will be disabled. The client can then show the warnings to the user and the user can manually confirm that they accept the warnings, i.e. duplicate payment detected</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_FORCE_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirm will be executed even if there are warnings.Validation errors will of course disable confirm as the payment is invalid.Warnings will still be shown in the response but if the user wishes to not to perform the payment, then payment must be cancelled if possible (note that real-time payments will have already been performed and cannot be cancelled).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. This is typically a security Object retriewed from a logon, but can also be a plain password.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicated what type of application that initiated the request</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orgid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The OrganizationalId - will in a banking context be Financial Institution / Konsernnr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="orgunit" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Organizational unit will in a banking context be Branch / Registernr</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="customerid" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Id of the customer on which the operation is requested, may be the same as userid, but may well be different</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="locale" nillable="true" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Locale in a java syntax e.g "en_EN". May be used if application supports localized response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ip" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The ip adress of the client</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="item" nillable="true" type="itemType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optionnal extention items - Add key/value pairs for application specific extentions</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="itemType"> <xsd:attribute name="key" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="EDBHeaderType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SourceApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the source that initiated the message. Used to separate different service consumers.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DestinationApplication" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the destination of the message. <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="faxNumber" type="cm:PhoneNumber"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="emailAddress" type="cm:Max254Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contactDetailsName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="cm:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. mesage level, payment info level, etc.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element payments independently of currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element <xs:documentation>This value signifies that both the PWH and RBS database registers should be used</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:nationalinformation-nor:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment request information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementCapture" type="tns:AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If the beneficiary offers AvtaleGiro agreements, eInvoice agreements, or both, this might be fetched at payment time and a proposal presented. Use this field to control the proposal fetch. If not defined, no agreement capture will be performed. AVTALEGIRO to fetch potential AvtaleGiro proposals, COMBINATION for fetching proposal which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvocing reference). Should only be used for payments with CID defined. If this value is given, a possible agreement capture proposal will be returned in the response for the given AgreementCaptureType. This should only be used for payments with CID defined (see creditorScorReference).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="NorwegianNationalPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO Norwegian specific payment information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="ct:NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="agreementProposalCapture" type="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Object containing information relevant to agreement capture. I.e. if the payer is registering a bill to a beneficiary offering AvtaleGiro, the payer could be offered an AvtaleGiro proposal immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="receiptOrder" type="tns:ReceiptType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If this value is given, a receipt will be ordered for the given type. Even though this is available in the paymentUpdateMessage, if this is the only field to update for the payment, consider rather using the PINSPaymentUtil.ReceiptOrderUpdate web service operations which also supports creating receipt orders after the payment has been completed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="EProviderProposal" type="tns:EProviderProposal"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information about name and status of eInvoice providers.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceDetails" type="ct:EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice details for payments using eInvoice</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Generic type for all agreement proposal captures</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The AvtaleGiro proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eInvoice agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ProviderId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura issuer's unique Id inside the Norwegian eFaktura B2C solution.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandId" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The brand id to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="BrandName" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The name of the eFaktura provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="CustomerReference" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Consumer electronic invoice reference. A unique identification of the customer to the eFaktura provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="ProposalId" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eFaktura proposal id</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CombinationProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains both a eInvoiceProposalCapture and an AvtaleGiroProposalCapture</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="tns:AgreementProposalCapture"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="EInvoiceProposalCapture" type="tns:EInvoiceProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new eFaktura agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="AvtaleGiroProposalCapture" type="tns:AvtaleGiroProposalCapture"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Present if a new AvtaleGiro agreement proposal is captured.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EProviderProposal"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="EInvoiceProvider" nillable="true" type="tns:EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The eInvoice provider which is registered on the customer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="Status" nillable="true" type="tns:EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The status on this agreement with the einvoice provider.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="DatePostponed" nillable="true" type="xs:date"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The customer has answered no to sign an agreement with eInvoice provider. The customer will be asked again after this date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AgreementCaptureType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="AVTALEGIRO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request to fetch potential AvtaleGiro agreement proposals</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="COMBINATION"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Use this value in the request for fetching proposals which offer both products (e.g. an AvtaleGiroPayment with eInvoicing reference)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EInvoiceProviderEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EProviderStatusEnum"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider, but no agreement with the bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider and bank</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="POSTPONED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An agreement with the bank is not wanted now</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INACTIVE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Agreement with provider is canceled</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOPROSPECT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No agreement with provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ReceiptType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="STICKER"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Receipt sticker</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PRINT"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Printed receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No receipt</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGRD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Exchange rate applied is the rate agreed between the parties.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="EinvoiceType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EINVOICE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Nets</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DIGIPOST"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from Posten</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ECOMMERCE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from ECOMMERCE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>einvoice from EBOX</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="UUIDv4Type"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:pattern value="[a-f0-9]{8}-[a-f0-9]{4}-4[a-f0-9]{3}-[ab89]{1}[a-f0-9]{3}-[a-f0-9]{12}"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="ServiceLevelCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="URGP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Urgent payment - ISO code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTP"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Norwegian real-time payment - EVRY proprietary code. The transaction will be reserved on both the debitor and creditor and completed immediately.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EINV"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice - EVRY proprietary code. This service level will indicate that the payment initiation system should mark the eInvoice as ready for due date/paid in the external system, i.e. NETS. If an eInvoice is created with in payment initiation without this service level, it is the responsibility of the calling system to update NETS.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="INTD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal direct debit - EVRY proprietary code</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NRTR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No real time reservation - EVRY proprietary code. This can be used if the due date is equal to today's date to skip over an immediate reservation, that is, to create reservations when the ReservationEngine normally runs</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DRDB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Direct debit - EVRY proprietary code (for example, AvtaleGiro)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="GLMS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use from GLM. It will force the payment being processed as "real foreign account", and sent as MT101 (or whatever PBD's foreign agreement says)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="NOCR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>For use in domestic and foreign domestic, normal priority payments without an advice out.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ZRCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will activate skipping charges during payment processing. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DVCH"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This service level will mark the payment as having a deviating charge. This is a proprietary EVRY code (not ISO-20022 complient)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="AutoConfirm"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="DISABLED"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Default if not given. Clients will require calling payment status update confirm web service to activate the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_BUT_DISABLED_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>If any warnings are encountered during validation, then autoConfirm will be disabled. The client can then show the warnings to the user and the user can manually confirm that they accept the warnings, i.e. duplicate payment detected</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="ENABLED_FORCE_ON_WARNINGS"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confirm will be executed even if there are warnings.Validation errors will of course disable confirm as the payment is invalid.Warnings will still be shown in the response but if the user wishes to not to perform the payment, then payment must be cancelled if possible (note that real-time payments will have already been performed and cannot be cancelled).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> <xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="http://edb.com/ws/WSCommon_v22"> <xsd:complexType name="ClientContextType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="userid" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies the person who initiated the action This could either be the customer itself in a netbank) or an employee</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="credentials" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorization data. Default is english language. <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: Set of elements used to identify a person or an <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of person to receive information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PostalAddress"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PAYS can do validations against the country code (depending on which party/agent type it is). All other fields is information only, and is sent to Payment Engine without any form of validation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="addressType" type="tns:AddressTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO "Identifies the nature of the postal address. Values: ADDR, PBOX, HOME, BIZZ, MLTO, DLVY</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="department" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO:
