<xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of a sub-division of a large organisation or building."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="streetName" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a street or thoroughfare."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="buildingNumber" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Number that identifies the position of a building on a street."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="postCode" type="cm:Max16Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="townName" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="countrySubDivision" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="country" type="cm:CountryCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Nation with its own government."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="7" minOccurs="0" name="addressLine" type="cm:Max70Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="AddressTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="ADDR"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the complete postal address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PBOX"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is a postal office (PO) box.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOME"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the home address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BIZZ"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the business address.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MLTO"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which mail is sent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="DLVY"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Address is the address to which delivery is to take place.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="FinancialInstitutionIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to uniquely and unambiguously identify a financial institution or a branch of a financial institution."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="bic" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362; Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="nationalId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Depending on validations against PBD, will be mapped against the following ISO fields: 1: MemberIdentification - "Identification of a member of a clearing system" 2: Other - ""Unique identification of an agent, as assigned by an institution, using an identification scheme Regarding 1, PAYS will also add a ClearingSystemIdentification to uniquely identify the agent within the correct clearing system of that country. This ID can be found in ISO's ExternalCodeList overview.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="name" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="postalAddress" type="tns:PostalAddress"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element default="SPOT" minOccurs="0" name="rateType" type="st:ExchangeRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type used to complete the currency exchange." Values: SPOT, SALE, AGRD</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique and unambiguous reference to the foreign exchange contract agreed between the initiating party/creditor and the debtor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentIdentification"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party, and sent to the next party in the chain to unambiguously identify the message." Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="endToEndIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification assigned by the initiating party to unumbiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain. " NB! endToendIdentification will remain unchanged in updates (as opposed to other ids return in create response. This field is therefore a good canditate to follow a payment in audit trail.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="instructedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="equivalentAmount" type="tns:EquivalentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, expressed in the currency of the debtor's account, and the currency in which the amount is to be moved.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EquivalentAmount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="tns:Amount"/> <xs:element name="currencyOfTransfer" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the currency of the to be transferred amount, which is different from the currency of the debtor's account."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides the details to identify an account.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max34Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Account identifier; IBAN or other generic identifier</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identification of the currency in which the account is held.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Amount"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Balance"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Balance_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AmountOptionalCurrency"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="currency" type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAmounts"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Contains information regarding debit and credit amount along with counter values and conversionRate info. At least one of debitCounterValue and creditCounterValue is always set. This information is always recalculated in Read/Search</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="debitAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the debtor account currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the transfer currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be deducted from the debtor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditCounterValue" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount to be transferred to the creditor, expressed in the base currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="conversionRateInfo" type="tns:ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Rate used to convert between the debit and credit amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ConversionRateInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="rate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "The factor used for conversion of an amount from one currency to another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="type" type="tns:ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the type of rate used when performing exchange rate conversion." Values: NONE, AGREED_RATE, SELL_RATE, BUY_RATE, MID_RATE, CROSS_RATE</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="unitNumber"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Describes the unit number. Possible values: 1 and 100.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:int"> <xs:enumeration value="1"/> <xs:enumeration value="100"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="ConversionRateTypeCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="NONE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>No conversion has been done.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="AGREED_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using an agreed rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="SELL_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a sell rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="BUY_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a buy rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="MID_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a mid rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="CROSS_RATE"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Conversion has been done using a cross rate.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cm:Max10Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the nature, purpose, and reason for the transaction to be reported for regulatory and statutory requirements in a coded form. " A PBD-service can provide these codes.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="information" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Additional details that cater for specific domestic regulatory requirements.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Creditor agent instructions (either predefined code words, or proprietary code words for use in older exchange formats)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="code" type="tns:InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Coded information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor's agent." Values: CHQB, HOLD, PHOB, TELB</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="proprietaryCode" type="cm:Max8Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>non-ISO-20022: "This field can be used for other codeWords/instructions for other payment standards (ISO-15022, etc.). This data will be ignored for ISO-20022 outgoing messages."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information complementing the coded instruction or instruction to the creditor's agent that is bilaterally agreed or specific to a user community."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="InstructionForCreditorAgentCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHQB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>(Ultimate) creditor must be paid by cheque.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="HOLD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount of money must be held for the (ultimate) creditor, who will call. Pay on identification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="PHOB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by phone</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TELB"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Please advise/contact (ultimate) creditor/claimant by the most efficient means of telecommunication.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Approval"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="dateOfApproval" type="cm:ISODate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Approver"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="approverFirstName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="approverLastName" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element name="identification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EinvoiceDetails"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>NON-ISO field All details regarding eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="invoiceReference" type="cm:Max200Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference of eInvoice.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="providerId" type="st:ProviderId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>eInvoice provider</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="brandId" type="st:BrandId"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional id of an eInvoice provider, e.g 001, 002</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="eInvoiceOwnerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The id for the owner of the eInvoice. See also initiatorIdentifier that is the id of the party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="eInvoiceType" type="st:EinvoiceType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The type of eInvoice, based on from where it comes from.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements used to identify the documents referred to in the remittance information." Values: CINV, CREN Default: CINV</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="issuer" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Identification of the issuer of the reference document type"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="number" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationStructured" type="tns:RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="RemittanceInformationStructured"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="creditorReferenceInformation" type="tns:CreditorReferenceInformation"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="3" minOccurs="0" name="additionalRemittanceInformation" type="cm:Max140Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ReferredDocumentAmount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Provides details on the amounts of the referred document.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="duePayableAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified is the exact amount due and payable to the document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittedAmount" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Amount specified for the referred document is the amount of a credit note.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="CreditorReferenceInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="type" type="st:CreditorReferenceInformationType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Type of creditor reference, in a coded form Values: type="cm:ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode"/> <xs:element name="exchangeRate" type="cm:BaseOneRate"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="contractIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="quotationDate" type="cm:ISODateTime"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SettlementChargeInfo"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="chargedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> mesage level, payment info level, etc.)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="accurateAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"/> <xs:element name="AggregatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmountBaseCurrency" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for payments calculated in base currency</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="sumAmount" type="cm:Amount_SimpleType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Sum amount for all selected payments independently of currency.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="AccumulatedAmountType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="accumulatedAmount" type="tns:Amount"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="StatusReason"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="st:StatusReasonCode"/> <xs:element name="message" type="cm:Max170Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Additional message explaining the reason. Might come from the external system without any modifications</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="sourceSystem" type="cm:Max35Text"/> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="additionalInfo" type="cm:Max105Text"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="NationalSpecificPaymentRequestInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: Generic type for all information specific to the nation for the request (for example AvtaleGiro/eInvoice capture, receipt requests, etc. in Norway). This type is used in the WS request objects (i.e. agreement capture request)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType abstract="true" name="NationalSpecificPaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Non-ISO: Generic type for all information specific to the nation for the request (for example AvtaleGiro/eInvoice capture proposals, receipt requests, etc. in Norway). This type is used in the WS response objects (i.e. agreement proposal response).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentAdditionalInfo"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Payment additional information</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debitValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Debit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditValueDate" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The Credit value date rule</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ChargeOption"> <xs:sequence> <xs:choice> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Either, indication of whether payment's original charge should be preserved or not, or specification of an explicit charge that should be applied.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="preserveOriginalChargeParameters" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates whether the payment's original initiatorId and channel should be preserved when charge is retrieved. Setting this to false means that charge will be retrieved based on the current userId and PaymentChannel.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="charge" type="tns:Amount"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The charge to be applied to the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EditPaymentOptions"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeOption" type="tns:ChargeOption"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PaymentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of characteristics that applies to the debit side of the payment transactions included in the credit transfer initiation.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentMethod" type="tns:PaymentMethodCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the means of payment that will be used to move the amount of money." Values: CHK, TRA, TRF. DNB payment engine only accepts TRF.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentTypeInformation" type="tns:PaymentTypeInformation"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="requestedExecutionDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Date at which the initiating party requests the clearing agent to process the payment. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="requestedCreditValueDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The requested credit value date for the payment. Can be given as an alternative to requestedExecutionDate. This is the date on which the creditor's account is to be credited.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtorAgentBIC" type="cm:BICFIIdentifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>BIC of debtor agent. Only needs to be provided if debtor agent is other than initiator agent, e.g. for foreign account purposes. If left out, PI will set debtorAgent=initiatorAgent.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateDebtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Ultimate party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionForDebtorAgent" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, that may need to be acted upon by the debtor agent, depending on agreement between debtor and the debtor agent. Usage: when present, then the instructions for the debtor agent apply for all credit transfer transaction information occurrences, present in the payment information."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="PaymentMethodCode"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CHK"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Written order to a bank to pay a certain amount of money from one person to another person.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="TRF"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Transfer of an amount of money in the books of the account servicer.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentTypeInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Set of elements used to further specify the type of transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="instructionPriority" type="st:PriorityCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Urgency or order of importance that the originator would like the recipient of the payment instruction to apply to the processing of the payment instruction."
Values: HIGH, NORM
Default: NORM</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="serviceLevel" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Agreement under which or rules under which the transaction should be processed"
Values: URGP, NRTP, INTD, EINV, NRTR, DRDB, GLMS
Default: (none)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="localInstrument" type="cm:LocalInstrumentCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "User community specific instrument. Usage: This element is used to specify a local instrument, local clearing option and/or further qualify the service or service level."
Values: TO BE DECIDED! (not an enum yet..)
Default:</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="categoryPurpose" type="st:CategoryPurposeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction based on a set of pre-defined categories. Usage: This is used by the initiating party to provide information concerning the processing of the payment. It is likely to trigger special processing by any of the agents involved in the payment chain."
For banks using DNB Payment engine for international payments: PI will set this value based on instructionPriority.
Values: INVS, SALA, IDCP, CASH, CORT, INTC, PENS, SSBE, SUPP, TAXS, TREA, VATX, LOAN, OTHR
Default: SUPP</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0" xmlns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="CreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="exchangeRateInformation" type="ct:ExchangeRate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides details on the currency exchange rate and contract."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chargeBearer" type="st:ChargeBearerTypeCode"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction." Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."
Optional only when PaymentType is Cheque</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="ultimateCreditor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Ultimate party to which an amount of money is due.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" name="instructionForCreditorAgent" type="ct:InstructionForCreditorAgent"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Further information related to the processing of the payment instruction, provided by the initiating party, and intended for the creditor agent."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="regulatoryReporting" type="ct:RegulatoryReporting"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Information needed due to regulatory and statutory requirements."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="internalNote" type="cm:Max40Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Internal note, not part of the ISO standard.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="chequeInstruction" type="ct:ChequeInstruction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Set of elements needed to issue a cheque."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:choice minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Purp - Underlying reason for the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:element name="purposeCode" type="cm:Max4Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See ISO "Payment Purpose Code" external code set for valid values</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="purposeProprietary" type="cm:Max35Text"/> </xs:choice> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="uetrId" type="st:UUIDv4Type"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique End-to-End Transaction Reference contains UUID compliant with version 4 of standard RFC4122</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="SimpleCreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Provides information on the individual transaction(s) included in the message." Here: a simplified transaction compared to CreditTransferTransactiond-element.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instructionIdentification" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unique identification as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party to unambiguously identify the instruction" Usage: the instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.
Client must provide each transaction an id in order to link possible error codes in the response with the erroneous transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="customerId" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies customer connected to the prepaid card in the recharge system. Mandatory when PaymentList Type is IDCP Recharge Pre pay cards</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="amount" type="ct:AmountTypeChoice"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party."
Since paymentList only support domestic payments, it would only make sense to use instructed amount.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="creditorName" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party to which an amount of money is due." Here: simplified to only use name.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="remittanceInformationUnstructured" type="cm:Max140Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in an unstructured form."
Here: limit to only 1 x 140 characters</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="creditorScorReference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Used to reference OCR/KID
The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money. If the business context requires the use of a creditor reference or a payment remit identification, and only one identifier can be passed through the end-to-end chain, the creditor's reference or payment remittance identification should be quoted in the end-to-end transaction identification."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="confidential" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Confidential flag. Payments created/updated with this flag will only show in Search if user has Confidential role.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> <xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tns="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:paymentinitiation:v2_0" xmlns:st="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0" xmlns:deb="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0" xmlns:ct="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0" xmlns:cre="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0" xmlns:cm="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:complex-types:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:debtor:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:creditor:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:common:v2_0"/> <xs:import namespace="urn:pins.payment.evry.com:domain:simple-types:v2_0"/> <xs:complexType name="PaymentCreateMessage"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The payment initiation message can contain only one payment information and one credit transfer transaction.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="paymentIdentification" type="ct:PaymentIdentification"/> <xs:element name="paymentInfo" type="deb:PaymentInformation"/> <xs:element name="transaction" type="tns:CreditTransferTransactionRequestType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="referredDocumentInformation" type="ct:ReferredDocumentInformation"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Invoice details</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="autoConfirm" type="st:AutoConfirm"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be automatically confirmed. Usage: This is the date on which the debtor's account is to be debited. If payment by cheque, the date when the cheque must be generated by the bank.""</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="requestedCreditValueDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The requested credit value date for the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:choice> <xs:element name="debtorAccount" type="ct:Account"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Unambiguous identification of the account of the debtor to which a debit entry will be made as a result of the transaction"</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="debtor" type="ct:PartyIdentification"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>ISO: "Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor."</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" name="transactions" type="cre:SimpleCreditTransferTransaction"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>List of CreditTransferTransactions. The transactions are a simplified version of the transactions used in PaymentCreate/Update. Setting this to false means that the payment will only be validated, and requires a separate confirm request to be processed.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="retailPaymentApprovalNeeded" type="xs:boolean"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Indicates that the payment should be set to status TO_BE_APPROVED once confirmed instead of READY_FOR_DUE_DATE.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="fundsCheckRetryDays" type="xs:int"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This value is the maximum number of days coverage control will be retried before setting the payment status to stopped. If not set, then PIN fetches the value from PBD.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="PaymentResult"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The complete payment instruction result.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the message level (ISO: GroupHeader) of the payment. Can be used in subsequent statusUpdates against the payment info level</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:long"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A database id for the transaction (ISO: CreditTransferTransactionInformation) level of the payment. Can be used in subsequent updates/statusUpdates against the transaction level (e.g confirm, approve, stop, reactivate, etc)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="initiatorIdentifier" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The party that initiates the payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentReference" type="cm:Max35Text"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unique reference to this payment.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="paymentAmounts" type="ct:PaymentAmounts"/> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="releaseDate" type="cm:ISODate"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This field shows the earliest possible date for when the this payment will be due date processed. The ISO reference is RemittanceInformation.Structured.CreditorReferenceInformation.Code/Reference=SCOR, and has been flattened here.
SCOR = StructuredCommunicationReference: Document is a structured communication reference provided by the creditor to identify the referred transaction.
ISO: "Unique reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction. Usage: If available, the initiating party should provide this reference in the structured remittance information, to enable reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.
